unnormalised: **5G Rollout Accelerates Across India, Driven by Jio and Airtel**
normalised: five G rollout accelerates across India, driven by Jio and Airtel

unnormalised: New Delhi, 16/10/2024 – The nationwide rollout of 5G services is gaining significant momentum, with Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel leading the charge. Millions of users across metros like Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata are already experiencing enhanced connectivity speeds, with average download speeds reportedly exceeding 500 Mbps in certain areas.
normalised: new Delhi, sixteenth October two thousand and twenty four – The nationwide rollout of five G services is gaining significant momentum, with Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel leading the charge. Millions of users across metros like Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata are already experiencing enhanced connectivity speeds, with average download speeds reportedly exceeding five hundred M B P S in certain areas.

unnormalised: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) data released today indicates a substantial increase in 5G subscriptions since the services became commercially available in October 2022. Analysts predict that 5G adoption will surpass 200 million users by December 2025.
normalised: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) data released today indicates a substantial increase in five G subscriptions since the services became commercially available in October two thousand and twenty two. Analysts predict that five G adoption will surpass two hundred million users by December two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: "The government's commitment to infrastructure development, coupled with private sector investment, is crucial for realizing the Digital India vision," stated Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw during an industry conference at 10:00 hrs today. He also announced the next spectrum auction scheduled for 26/01/2025.
normalised: "The government's commitment to infrastructure development, coupled with private sector investment, is crucial for realizing the Digital India vision," stated Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw during an industry conference at ten o'clock hours today. He also announced the next spectrum auction scheduled for twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: Both Jio and Airtel are expanding their 5G networks to Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, with plans to cover 80% of the country's population by mid-2025. Jio has reportedly invested over Rs. 1.5 lakh crore in its 5G infrastructure, while Airtel's investment is estimated at Rs. 1.2 lakh crore. This includes deploying towers and fiber optic cables covering approximately 250,000 km. The benefits are expected to extend beyond individual users, impacting sectors like manufacturing, healthcare, and agriculture. Expect updates on the rollout at 17:00 hrs tomorrow.
normalised: Both Jio and Airtel are expanding their five G networks to Tier-two and Tier-three cities, with plans to cover eighty percent of the country's population by mid-two thousand and twenty five. Jio has reportedly invested over rupee one point five lakh crore in its five G infrastructure, while Airtel's investment is estimated at rupee one point two lakh crore. This includes deploying towers and fiber optic cables covering approximately two hundred and fifty thousand kilometer. The benefits are expected to extend beyond individual users, impacting sectors like manufacturing, healthcare, and agriculture. Expect updates on the rollout at seventeen o'clock hours tomorrow.
